member.name: SHCONTF
member.summary: Determines the types of items included in an enumeration. These values are used with the method.

member.name: SHCONTF.SHCONTF_CHECKING_FOR_CHILDREN
member.summary: 0x00010. Windows 7 and later. The calling application is checking for the existence of child items in the folder.

member.name: SHCONTF.SHCONTF_FOLDERS
member.summary: 0x00020. Include items that are folders in the enumeration.

member.name: SHCONTF.SHCONTF_NONFOLDERS
member.summary: 0x00040. Include items that are not folders in the enumeration.

member.name: SHCONTF.SHCONTF_INCLUDEHIDDEN
member.summary: 0x00080. Include hidden items in the enumeration. This does not include hidden system items. (To include hidden system items, use SHCONTF_INCLUDESUPERHIDDEN.)

member.name: SHCONTF.SHCONTF_INIT_ON_FIRST_NEXT
member.summary: 0x00100. No longer used; always assumed. can return without validating the enumeration object. Validation can be postponed until the first call to . Use this flag when a user interface might be displayed prior to the first IEnumIDList.Next call. For a user interface to be presented, hwnd must be set to a valid window handle.

member.name: SHCONTF.SHCONTF_NETPRINTERSRCH
member.summary: 0x00200. The calling application is looking for printer objects.

member.name: SHCONTF.SHCONTF_SHAREABLE
member.summary: 0x00400. The calling application is looking for resources that can be shared.

member.name: SHCONTF.SHCONTF_STORAGE
member.summary: 0x00800. Include items with accessible storage and their ancestors, including hidden items.

member.name: SHCONTF.SHCONTF_NAVIGATION_ENUM
member.summary: 0x01000. Windows 7 and later. Child folders should provide a navigation enumeration.

member.name: SHCONTF.SHCONTF_FASTITEMS
member.summary: 0x02000. Windows Vista and later. The calling application is looking for resources that can be enumerated quickly.

member.name: SHCONTF.SHCONTF_FLATLIST
member.summary: 0x04000. Windows Vista and later. Enumerate items as a simple list even if the folder itself is not structured in that way.

member.name: SHCONTF.SHCONTF_ENABLE_ASYNC
member.summary: 0x08000. Windows Vista and later. The calling application is monitoring for change notifications. This means that the enumerator does not have to return all results. Items can be reported through change notifications.

member.name: SHCONTF.SHCONTF_INCLUDESUPERHIDDEN
member.summary: 0x10000. Windows 7 and later. Include hidden system items in the enumeration. This value does not include hidden non-system items. (To include hidden non-system items, use SHCONTF_INCLUDEHIDDEN.)
